intro: Dicoma niccolifera, commonly known as the silverleaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its silver-gray, fuzzy leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its composite flower heads. Dicoma niccolifera is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it a notable species in its native habitat.
